description:
10/22/2023 – at around 5:44 p.m.  at the intersection of SE Brookwood Avenue and SE Montego Street.  
 Weather was clear and pavement surface was dry.  
 This crash involved a vehicle versus a person in a wheelchair which resulted in no injuries.  
 The driver was traveling northbound on SE Brookwood Ave as they approached SE Montego Drive when they realized they needed to turn left onto SE Montego Drive. Driver made a quick turn and 
 
 didn't realize there was a pedestrian crossing the road and clipped the wheelchair with the front 
passenger side bumper.  
The person in the wheelchair, was crossing from the southside of the road to the northside on the eastside of SE Brookwood when they were bumped by the car because they “steered away” from it.  The pedestrian said they were not injured nor were they knocke d from their chair, nor was their chair 
damaged from being hit.  
 An independent collaborated the incident actions.  
 
No citations were issued.  
 Staff visited the crash site to investigate factors that might have caused the crash and found none.

10/27/2023 – at around 12:32 p.m. at the intersection of SE Baseline Street and SE 3rd Avenue.  
 This crash involved a vehicle versus a bicyclist . Bicyclist  reported minor injuries .  
 Weather was clear and pavement sur face was dry . 
 The bicyclist was travelling eastbound on the sidewalk on SE Baseline and crossed SE 3
rd Ave when they 
were struck by the vehicle. Bicyclist said they knew vehicles had a green light but thought they "had 
enough time."  
 
The driver was westbound on SE Baseline and turned left as their light was green. They said the bicyclist struck the side of their vehicle.  
 It is unknow if citations were issued.  
 Staff did not visit the crash site to investigate , as the crash factor in this crash was the bicyclist who 
failed to obey a traffic control device.

11/11/2023 – at around 8:51 a.m. at the intersection of SE Baseline St. and SE 4th Ave.  
 
Weather was rainy and pavement surface was wet.
 
This crash involved a vehicle vers us pedestrian where minor injuries were suspected.  
 
The driver was i n the far -left hand lane of SE  Baseline St., approaching the intersection at  SE 4th Ave. 
The driver did not notice the vehicle stopped  in the other lane . The pedestrian ran out in front of the 
vehicle where he was struck.  
 The pedestrian said they stopped before crossing south, at SE 4th Ave. and SE Baseline Rd. The 
pedestrian observed no  traffic in the lane closest to them and the traffic in the middle lane stopped,  
 and they didn’t observe  traffic in the far-left lane of SE Baseline Rd.,  so they began to cross SE Baseline 
St., south, by  running. The vehicle came out of nowhere and they were struck.  
 
The driver was cited for failing to yield the right of way to the pedestrian.  
 Staff did not visit the crash site to investigate , as the crash factor in this crash was the driver who failed 
to stop for the pedestrian in the roadway.
